meanings.definition: The ability to be easily expanded or upgraded.
meanings.sent1: The scalability of the software allows it to grow with the company's needs.
meanings.sent2: Our website's scalability ensures it can handle more users as our business expands.
meanings.sent3: The scalability of the cloud storage system made it seem like it had magical powers.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity had a scalability that rivaled the endless expanse of the universe.
meanings.sent5: The scalability of the building project made it seem like it could reach the sky.

meanings.definition: The capacity to handle growth or increased demand.
meanings.sent1: The scalability of the network infrastructure allowed it to accommodate the sudden surge in traffic.
meanings.sent2: The scalability of the production line ensured that it could meet the increased demand for the product.
meanings.sent3: The scalability of the tiny bakery to handle a sudden rush of customers was both impressive and comical.
meanings.sent4: The scalability of her patience was like a bottomless well, never running dry.
meanings.sent5: The scalability of the garden to produce more vegetables was a testament to the gardener's skill.

meanings.definition: The quality of being able to adapt to changing circumstances.
meanings.sent1: The scalability of the team in adjusting to new challenges was commendable.
meanings.sent2: The scalability of the business model allowed it to pivot quickly in response to market changes.
meanings.sent3: The scalability of the robot's dance moves to different music genres was both surprising and entertaining.
meanings.sent4: Her scalability in handling unexpected situations was like a superhero's power to adapt to any threat.
meanings.sent5: The scalability of the chameleon's color-changing ability was a marvel of nature.
